location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 42 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter reports that the Resident's efforts to mediate between Rama bin Jauber [Raḥmah bin Jābir] and Abdulla bin Ahmed [Shaikh ‘Abdullāh bin Aḥmad Āl Khalīfah], Shaikh of Bahrain, have failed. It also briefly mentions a reported complaint from Sooltan bin Suggar [Sulṭān bin Saqr] that two of his people have been murdered by the people of Eymaim.
